pages.text: How does a Turbine generate energy?$(br2)By spinning its $(l:bigreactors:turbine/rotor)Rotor$(/l).$(br2)The fluid from the Turbine Vapor Fluid Tank is pumped in the $(l:bigreactors:turbine/rotor)Rotor$(/l) chamber, at the rate you configured in the $(l:bigreactors:turbine/part-controller)Controller$(/l) graphical interface.$(br2)A small amount of the vapor it's captured by each $(l:bigreactors:turbine/part-rotorblade)Rotor Blade$(/l) making the $(l:bigreactors:turbine/rotor)Rotor$(/l) spin.

When the $(l:bigreactors:turbine/coils)Induction Coils$(/l) are $(l:bigreactors:turbine/part-controller)engaged$(/l), energy is generated depending on the $(l:bigreactors:turbine/rotor)Rotor$(/l) speed and the average values of properties like efficiency and drag amount of all your your coil blocks.$(br2)$(italic)Please note that, while being close enough to let you create the best Turbines possible, this is an oversimplification of what's really going on inside your Turbine.$()
